Package actor

Class Actor

java.lang.Object
actor.Actor
Direct Known Subclasses:
Block, EmptyActor, Monster, Player
public class Actor extends Object
Represents all actor entities in the game, including their positions using a coordinate pair (x, y). The class provides functionalities for moving actors, checking collisions, and interacting with game elements like traps and buttons.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    Actor.Direction
    Enum representing possible directions an actor can move in the game.

    • collidesWith

      public boolean collidesWith(Actor actor)
      Detects if another actor is on the same tile as the current actor.
      Parameters:
      actor - The actor to detect collison with.
      Returns:
      collides If the actor collides.

    • checkCollision

      public boolean checkCollision(Actor.Direction direction)
      Checks for collision in a specified direction. Determines if moving in the given direction would result in a collision with another actor.
      Parameters:
      direction - The direction in which to check for a collision.
      Returns:
      True if a collision would occur, false otherwise.

    • onButton

      public void onButton(tile.GameButton button)
      Handles the actor's interaction when standing on a button. Typically used to trigger or toggle traps associated with the button.
      Parameters:
      button - The GameButton the actor interacts with.

    • onIce

      public void onIce(tile.Tile curTile)
      Moves the entity while it is on an ice tile, simulating sliding movement. The entity continues to slide in the current direction until it encounters a non-passable tile. If the tile it encounters is also an ice tile, it will change its direction accordingly.
      Parameters:
      curTile - The current ice tile on which the entity is located.

    • checkActiveTrap

      public boolean checkActiveTrap()
      Checks if the actor is currently on an active trap. This method is typically used to determine if the actor should be affected by a trap.
      Returns:
      True if the actor is on an active trap, false otherwise.

    • getKey

      public String getKey()
      Retrieves the unique key of the actor.
      Returns:
      The key representing the actor.

    • onIce

      public void onIce()
      Handles the actor's interaction with ice tiles. Sets the slide direction based on the ice tile's properties.

    • getDirection

      public Actor.Direction getDirection()
      Retrieves the current movement direction of the actor.
      Returns:
      The current direction of the actor.

    • setDirection

      public void setDirection(Actor.Direction direction)
      Retrieves the current movement direction of the actor.
